doc.previous: Mission work in Samoa had begun in late 1830 by John Williams of the London Missionary Society arriving in Sapapali i from The Cook Islands and Tahiti 12 According to Barbara A West The Samoans were also known to engage in headhunting a ritual of war in which a warrior took the head of his slain opponent to give to his leader thus proving his bravery 13 However Robert Louis Stevenson who lived in Samoa from 1889 until his death in 1894 wrote in A Footnote to History Eight Years of Trouble in Samoa the Samoans are gentle people 14
